25struct Flag;
26Flag* FindFlagByPointer(const void* ptr);
27V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE Flag* FindFlagByName(const char* name);
28V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE Flag* FindImplicationFlagByName(const char* name);

30V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE base::Vector<Flag> Flags();
31
32// Helper struct for printing normalized flag names.
33struct FlagName {
34 const char* name;
35 bool negated;
36
37 constexpr FlagName(const char* name, bool negated)
38 : name(name), negated(negated) {
39 DCHECK_NE('\0', name[0]);
40 DCHECK_NE('!', name[0]);
41 }
42
43 constexpr explicit FlagName(const char* name)
44 : FlagName(name[0] == '!' ? name + 1 : name, name[0] == '!') {}
45};
46
47std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, FlagName flag_name);
48
49// This structure represents a single entry in the flag system, with a pointer
50// to the actual flag, default value, comment, etc. This is designed to be POD
51// initialized as to avoid requiring static constructors.
52struct Flag {
53 enum FlagType {
54 TYPE_BOOL,
55 TYPE_MAYBE_BOOL,
56 TYPE_INT,
57 TYPE_UINT,
58 TYPE_UINT64,
59 TYPE_FLOAT,
60 TYPE_SIZE_T,
61 TYPE_STRING,
62 };
63
64 enum class SetBy { kDefault, kWeakImplication, kImplication, kCommandLine };
65
66 constexpr bool IsAnyImplication(Flag::SetBy set_by) {
67 return set_by == SetBy::kWeakImplication || set_by == SetBy::kImplication;
68 }
69
70 FlagType type_; // What type of flag, bool, int, or string.
71 const char* name_; // Name of the flag, ex "my_flag".
72 void* valptr_; // Pointer to the global flag variable.
73 const void* defptr_; // Pointer to the default value.
74 const char* cmt_; // A comment about the flags purpose.
75 bool owns_ptr_; // Does the flag own its string value?
76 SetBy set_by_ = SetBy::kDefault;
77 // Name of the flag implying this flag, if any.
78 const char* implied_by_ = nullptr;
79#ifdef DEBUG
80 // Pointer to the flag implying this flag, if any.
81 const Flag* implied_by_ptr_ = nullptr;
82#endif
83
84 FlagType type() const { return type_; }
85
86 const char* name() const { return name_; }
87
88 const char* comment() const { return cmt_; }
89
90 bool PointsTo(const void* ptr) const { return valptr_ == ptr; }
91
92#ifdef DEBUG
93 bool ImpliedBy(const void* ptr) const {
94 const Flag* current = this->implied_by_ptr_;
95 while (current != nullptr) {
96 if (current->PointsTo(ptr)) return true;
97 current = current->implied_by_ptr_;
98 }
99 return false;
100 }
101#endif
102
103 bool bool_variable() const { return GetValue<TYPE_BOOL, bool>(); }
104
105 void set_bool_variable(bool value, SetBy set_by) {
106 SetValue<TYPE_BOOL, bool>(value, set_by);
107 }
108
109 base::Optional<bool> maybe_bool_variable() const {
110 return GetValue<TYPE_MAYBE_BOOL, base::Optional<bool>>();
111 }
112
113 void set_maybe_bool_variable(base::Optional<bool> value, SetBy set_by) {
114 SetValue<TYPE_MAYBE_BOOL, base::Optional<bool>>(value, set_by);
115 }
116
117 int int_variable() const { return GetValue<TYPE_INT, int>(); }
118
119 void set_int_variable(int value, SetBy set_by) {
120 SetValue<TYPE_INT, int>(value, set_by);
121 }
122
123 unsigned int uint_variable() const {
124 return GetValue<TYPE_UINT, unsigned int>();
125 }
126
127 void set_uint_variable(unsigned int value, SetBy set_by) {
128 SetValue<TYPE_UINT, unsigned int>(value, set_by);
129 }
130
131 uint64_t uint64_variable() const { return GetValue<TYPE_UINT64, uint64_t>(); }
132
133 void set_uint64_variable(uint64_t value, SetBy set_by) {
134 SetValue<TYPE_UINT64, uint64_t>(value, set_by);
135 }
136
137 double float_variable() const { return GetValue<TYPE_FLOAT, double>(); }
138
139 void set_float_variable(double value, SetBy set_by) {
140 SetValue<TYPE_FLOAT, double>(value, set_by);
141 }
142
143 size_t size_t_variable() const { return GetValue<TYPE_SIZE_T, size_t>(); }
144
145 void set_size_t_variable(size_t value, SetBy set_by) {
146 SetValue<TYPE_SIZE_T, size_t>(value, set_by);
147 }
148
149 const char* string_value() const {
150 return GetValue<TYPE_STRING, const char*>();
151 }
152
153 void set_string_value(const char* new_value, bool owns_new_value,
154 SetBy set_by);
155
156 template <typename T>
157 T GetDefaultValue() const {
158 return *reinterpret_cast<const T*>(defptr_);
159 }
160
161 bool bool_default() const {
162 DCHECK_EQ(TYPE_BOOL, type_);
163 return GetDefaultValue<bool>();
164 }
165
166 int int_default() const {
167 DCHECK_EQ(TYPE_INT, type_);
168 return GetDefaultValue<int>();
169 }
170
171 unsigned int uint_default() const {
172 DCHECK_EQ(TYPE_UINT, type_);
173 return GetDefaultValue<unsigned int>();
174 }
175
176 uint64_t uint64_default() const {
177 DCHECK_EQ(TYPE_UINT64, type_);
178 return GetDefaultValue<uint64_t>();
179 }
180
181 double float_default() const {
182 DCHECK_EQ(TYPE_FLOAT, type_);
183 return GetDefaultValue<double>();
184 }
185
186 size_t size_t_default() const {
187 DCHECK_EQ(TYPE_SIZE_T, type_);
188 return GetDefaultValue<size_t>();
189 }
190
191 const char* string_default() const {
192 DCHECK_EQ(TYPE_STRING, type_);
193 return GetDefaultValue<const char*>();
194 }
195
196 static bool ShouldCheckFlagContradictions();
197
198 // {change_flag} indicates if we're going to change the flag value.
199 // Returns an updated value for {change_flag}, which is changed to false if a
200 // weak implication is being ignored beause a flag is already set by a normal
201 // implication or from the command-line.
202 bool CheckFlagChange(SetBy new_set_by, bool change_flag,
203 const char* implied_by = nullptr);
204
205 bool IsReadOnly() const {
206 // See the FLAG_READONLY definition for FLAG_MODE_META.
207 return valptr_ == nullptr;
208 }
209
210 template <FlagType flag_type, typename T>
211 T GetValue() const {
212 DCHECK_EQ(flag_type, type_);
213 if (IsReadOnly()) return GetDefaultValue<T>();
214 return *reinterpret_cast<const FlagValue<T>*>(valptr_);
215 }
216
217 template <FlagType flag_type, typename T>
218 void SetValue(T new_value, SetBy set_by) {
219 DCHECK_EQ(flag_type, type_);
220 bool change_flag = GetValue<flag_type, T>() != new_value;
221 change_flag = CheckFlagChange(set_by, change_flag);
222 if (change_flag) {
223 DCHECK(!IsReadOnly());
224 *reinterpret_cast<FlagValue<T>*>(valptr_) = new_value;
225 }
226 }
227
228 // Compare this flag's current value against the default.
229 bool IsDefault() const;
230
231 void ReleaseDynamicAllocations();
232
233 // Set a flag back to it's default value.
234 V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE void Reset();
235
236 void AllowOverwriting() { set_by_ = SetBy::kDefault; }
237};
238
239} // namespace v8::internal
240
241#endif // V8_FLAGS_FLAGS_IMPL_H_
